title: Simon Cowell's advice to Max and Harvey off-camera on X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Simon Cowell is predicting big things for Max and Harvey on X Factor: Celebrity

(Picture: Rex)

Max and Harvey may not be on anyone over the age of 11’s radar just yet, but Nicole Scherzinger is tipping the YouTubers to win X Factor: Celebrity, and it sounds like Simon Cowell might be too.

Tonight the twins, aged 16, will confront some of the most powerful figures in music (and Louis Walsh) as they perform at Simon’s lavish Los Angeles pad, fighting for a place in the live shows.

The brothers belt out Ed Sheeran before Scherzy puts her hands up and forces them to re-evaluate their song choice, which turns out to be among her best decisions as they step up to the plate with a cover of Jonas Brothers comeback, Sucker.

Advertisement

After watching episode one, it appears the Syco record deal is theirs for the taking, and the boys revealed to press including Metro.co.uk that Simon gave them some strong advice off-camera which may suggest he agrees.

’I will remember for the rest of my life, there was one point where Simon sort of took us over and had a chat with us and basically said if we were to get through to the live shows he would want everything to come from us,’ revealed Max.

‘Be in our hands. Not be like anyone else forcing anyone on us. He just believes in the talent he has, that they are right. He’ll support them through that whole thing. Honestly he is a lovely man and I will remember that.’

Can Max and Harvey win X Factor: Celebrity? (Picture: ITV)

Max and Harvey have been singing together since they were seven-years-old and were previously signed to Disney’s record label. Their past experience and social media following (8 million fans and growing) has inevitably sparked a flurry of critics claiming they have an ‘unfair advantage’, but the duo insist they’re got just as much to prove as anyone else.

‘We have loving fans that support us and would love to support us through this whole thing and I’m sure they’ll be voting for us but everyone else has this mainstream TV like Jenny Ryan [from The Chase] and Martin Bashir.’ Harvey hit back.

‘I don’t know, everyone else has been brokered to the whole country whereas we have sort of stayed to one demographic.

‘We haven’t been released to the public yet, if you want to put it that way, when people see us for the first time they can decide if they want to vote for us or not but I feel like everyone is on a level playing ground to be honest.’

Max agreed: ‘The competing aspect is very different for us, we’ve never competed with anyone else before.

‘It’s a very different type of performing, you feel like if you haven’t given everything that you’ve got, you might as well have not done it. You are going for an end goal, and that end goal is to get a record contract.’

The X Factor: Celebrity kicks off tonight at 8.35pm on ITV.
